message.body: Do I just respond to this text?
hello! How are you?
I'm good. How are you doing?
I haven't had much luck actually having a text conversation with the others who signed up because they don't really answer!
I'm from Philly, and my mom used to work for the ldc language lab.
Great! I'm fine too.
My family went out after church for a fathers day lunch. How's your day going?
Just spending most of it online. I'm from NYC. I'm looking for a room today.
What denomination church?

Oh okay. So you're moving to another state or still within NYC? I bet there's a community group on Facebook that has postings for open rooms. I lived indc for years and used a Catholic fb housing group.,
Oh, Catholic. :)
That's cool. I went to Catholic School Ferron k to 12. I don't really subscribe to religion though. I'm looking to stay in nyc

Oh okay. I hope you are able to find a place soon. I love being Catholic and just finished a masters in theology at a pontifical university in dc. Actually one of my good friends is the associate chaplain at nyu and he is going to be the celebrant for my wedding this November. :)
That's pretty cool. Congrats on the whole marriage thing.
Thanks! Can I ask what you do in ny?
I have two jobs. I'm a personal assistant and I also work at a frozen yogurt place.

Nice. I bet your frozen yogurt place gets really busy in the summer! I'll be visiting ny to see my priest friend in August with my fiance. Apparently, Ihave to try 4 diff pizza places that he likes there...in the one day we'll be there!
Yeah most of the summer jobs here are all in ice cream and frozen yogurt places. I try not to have too much dairy and gluten. It's not good for the body.
Yeah. I remember hearing abt this "fun run 5k" or something in which after each lap, the runner needs to drink a glass of milk haha. That sounds like a drunk college idea.
... Probably not too fun.
Yeah that's gross. The bacteria builds up and you puke. Plus the stomach only holds about 32 ounces.

Yup. :( my dad is actually a marathoner and he ran his first ultramarathon this year. 31 miles for that one! He's already past mid-fifties but his goal is to run marathons in as many states as possible!
I'm not a runner though, I get distracted by nature haha.
My boyfriend wants to do a triathlon next year. He's kind of intense.

That's amazing. And yeah, intense. Last year for the dc triathlon, it rained hard right before, so they cancelled the swimming part bc overflow if wasteinto the Potomac. :( I was a live in nanny then for a family, and the mom was going to do the swimming part so she was disappointed.
Is the triathlon your boyfriend doing in ny?
It's in hawaii.
Oh wow, that sounds like an ideal place for a triathlon.
Yeah I'm excited for him.
I've never been to Hawaii, but as for the tropics, my family's from the Philippines, so we've visited our family a few times.
I'm not too into humid weather. I prefer the desert. Nevada is awesome.
Oh yeah, humidity gets harsh there! The first time I've ever experienced a non-humid but sunny environment was when I visited Denver. I've never been toNevada though.
What cities did you stay in when you went to Nevada?
Las Vegas. I really liked St. Louis, Missouri too
Oohh I'd like to visit st Louis someday. I have some friends who are in monasteries in st Louis. I bet the food is awesome too.
I was all about the night life when I went.
I bet it's pretty lively. I'm looking to live in the south after a few more years in dc. Hopefully somewhere in Texas where my fiance's from, but prob Au
stin, TX.
I'm not sure if I would leave nyc. Every time I get the idea something pops up and I end up staying.
Haha, the universe is telling you to stay. Are you originally from NYC?
Yeah from Queens.
Oh okay. I have to go for now. On my way to a goodbye dinner with another family whose child I cared for. Nice chatting with you! Hope you find a room soon!
